qas.question: What is Detroit's sports related nickname?
Who won the boxing title in 1937?
Who won the Stanley Cup in 1936?
Who won the World Series in 1935?

context: In the years following the mid-1930s, Detroit was referred to as the "<a0_0>City of Champions<a0_0/>" after the Tigers, Lions, and Red Wings captured all three major professional sports championships in a seven-month period of time (the <a4_0>Tigers<a4_0/> won the World Series in October 1935; the Lions won the NFL championship in December 1935; the <a3_0>Red Wings<a3_0/> won the Stanley Cup in April 1936). In 1932, Eddie "<a1_0>The Midnight Express<a1_0/>" Tolan from Detroit won the 100- and 200-meter races and two gold medals at the 1932 Summer Olympics. <a2_0>Joe Louis<a2_0/> won the heavyweight championship of the world in 1937.
